title: movie
text: package provides two datasets: summer_movies summer_movie_genres.
code: # Loading datasets data("summer_movies") data("summer_movie_genres")  # Viewing the first few rows of each dataset head(summer_movies) #> # A tibble: 6 × 10 #>   tconst    title_type primary_title original_title  year runtime_minutes genres #>   <chr>     <chr>      <chr>         <chr>          <dbl>           <dbl> <chr>  #> 1 tt0011462 movie      Midsummer Ma… Midsummer Mad…  1920              60 Drama  #> 2 tt0026714 movie      A Midsummer … A Midsummer N…  1935             133 Comed… #> 3 tt0033864 movie      The Teachers… Magistrarna p…  1941              86 Comedy #> 4 tt0037325 movie      Summer Storm  Summer Storm    1944             106 Crime… #> 5 tt0038406 movie      Centennial S… Centennial Su…  1946             102 Histo… #> 6 tt0038738 tvMovie    A Midsummer … A Midsummer N…  1946             150 Drama… #> # ℹ 3 more variables: simple_title <chr>, average_rating <dbl>, num_votes <dbl> head(summer_movie_genres) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   tconst    genres  #>   <chr>     <chr>   #> 1 tt0011462 Drama   #> 2 tt0026714 Comedy  #> 3 tt0026714 Fantasy #> 4 tt0026714 Romance #> 5 tt0033864 Comedy  #> 6 tt0037325 Crime

title: movie
text: summer_movies: dataset contains detailed information summer-themed movies, including movie titles, release year, runtime, genres, IMDb rating, number votes. summer_movie_genres: dataset includes genre information associated movie.

what: Using filter_movies_by_genre() to Filter Movies by Genre
title: movie
text: filter_movies_by_genre() function allows filter movies based specified genre.
code: # Filter for Comedy movies (case-insensitive match) comedy_movies <- filter_movies_by_genre(summer_movies, "Comedy")  # Display the first few rows of the filtered dataset head(comedy_movies) #> # A tibble: 6 × 10 #>   tconst    title_type primary_title original_title  year runtime_minutes genres #>   <chr>     <chr>      <chr>         <chr>          <dbl>           <dbl> <chr>  #> 1 tt0026714 movie      A Midsummer … A Midsummer N…  1935             133 Comed… #> 2 tt0033864 movie      The Teachers… Magistrarna p…  1941              86 Comedy #> 3 tt0039354 movie      One Swallow … En fluga gör …  1947              88 Comedy #> 4 tt0041507 movie      In the Good … In the Good O…  1949             102 Comed… #> 5 tt0042930 movie      Bountiful Su… Shchedroe leto  1951              87 Comed… #> 6 tt0043313 movie      Early Summer  Bakushû         1951             125 Comed… #> # ℹ 3 more variables: simple_title <chr>, average_rating <dbl>, num_votes <dbl>

title: movie
text: ’ve filtered data genre, can visualize trends, average IMDb ratings time, using ggplot2.
code: library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union comedy_movies_1925_1975 <- comedy_movies %>%   filter(year >= 1925 & year <= 1975)  # Check if data is available before plotting if (nrow(comedy_movies_1925_1975) > 0) {   ggplot(comedy_movies_1925_1975, aes(x = year, y = average_rating)) +     geom_line(color = "blue") +     geom_point() +     labs(title = "Average Ratings of Comedy Movies (1925-1975)",          x = "Year", y = "Average Rating") +     xlim(1925, 1975)  # Limit x-axis to specified range } else {   message("No data available for Comedy movies.") }

what: Distribution of Ratings for a Selected Genre
title: movie
text: can also explore distribution IMDb ratings specific genre. ’s visualize distribution ratings Comedy movies:
code: if (nrow(comedy_movies) > 0) {   ggplot(comedy_movies, aes(x = average_rating)) +     geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.5, fill = "skyblue", color = "black") +     labs(title = "Distribution of Ratings for Comedy Movies",          x = "Average Rating", y = "Frequency") } else {   message("No data available for Comedy movies.") }

title: movie
text: summarize_genre_statistics() function provides summary statistics genre, number movies, average rating, median rating.
code: library(dplyr) # Summarize genre statistics genre_summary <- summarize_genre_statistics(summer_movies) head(genre_summary) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   genres               movie_count mean_rating median_rating #>   <chr>                      <int>       <dbl>         <dbl> #> 1 Drama                        188        6.30           6.3 #> 2 Comedy                        63        5.94           6.1 #> 3 Drama,Romance                 63        6.37           6.5 #> 4 Documentary                   49        7.38           7.3 #> 5 Comedy,Drama                  46        6.43           6.3 #> 6 Comedy,Drama,Romance          35        6.12           5.9

what: Using the Shiny App for Interactive Exploration
title: movie
text: movie package includes interactive Shiny app, provides user-friendly interface filter movies genre, year range, rating.

title: movie
text: Explore Summer-Themed Movies app two main sections: Sidebar Panel: apply filters customize data displayed graphs. Main Panel: section displays graphs based filters selected Sidebar Panel.

previous_headings: App Layout > Step-by-Step Guide to Using the App
title: movie
text: Sidebar Panel provides filtering options narrow movie data genre, year range, minimum rating. Genre Dropdown: Select specific genre (e.g., Comedy, Drama) choose “” include movies genres. Use: Select genre dropdown view movies within genre. Choosing “” shows movies every genre. Year Range Slider: Filter movies release year. slider defaults entire range years dataset. Use: Adjust slider set start end years. example, setting 1990 2020 show movies released period. Minimum Rating Slider: Set minimum IMDb rating filter higher-rated movies. Use: Move slider set rating threshold. instance, minimum rating 7 display movies rated 7 . Download Button: Save filtered dataset computer CSV file.

previous_headings: App Layout > Step-by-Step Guide to Using the App
title: movie
text: Main Panel displays two visualizations based selected filters: Distribution Average Ratings: histogram shows distribution IMDb ratings movies matching selected filters. Higher bars indicate movies particular rating range. Average Rating Time: line plot shows trend average IMDb ratings time selected genre filters. helps observe rating trends changes years.

title: movie
text: explore popular Comedy movies 2000 onwards high ratings: Select Genre: Choose “Comedy”. Year Range: Set slider start 2000. Minimum Rating: Set rating slider 7. Download Data: Click “Download Filtered Data” save subset. graphs update show highly rated Comedy movies 2000 onwards.

title: movie
text: movie package provides powerful tools exploring analyzing summer-themed movies. can filter data genre, visualize trends time, use Shiny app interactive exploration. package ideal discovering insights summer-themed movies understanding different genres evolved years.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Neharika Shah. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Shah N (2024). movie: Provides Tools Exploring Analyzing Summer-Themed Movies Using IMDb Data. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://etc5523-2024.github.io/assignment-4-packages--shiny-apps-neharika999/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {movie: Provides Tools for Exploring and Analyzing Summer-Themed Movies Using IMDb Data},   author = {Neharika Shah},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://etc5523-2024.github.io/assignment-4-packages-and-shiny-apps-neharika999/}, }

what: Provides Tools for Exploring and Analyzing Summer-Themed Movies Using IMDb Data
title: Provides Tools for Exploring and Analyzing Summer-Themed Movies Using IMDb Data
text: movie package provides tools exploring analyzing summer-themed movies using IMDb data. package includes Shiny app interactive data exploration, functions filtering analyzing movie data, visualizations insights rating trends genre distributions. package designed help users discover trends, patterns, statistics related summer-themed movies. can view comprehensive guide package website.

title: Provides Tools for Exploring and Analyzing Summer-Themed Movies Using IMDb Data
text: can install movie package directly GitHub. First, ensure devtools package installed, use install_github(): can install development version movie GitHub :
code: # Install devtools if you haven't already install.packages("devtools")  # Install the movie package from GitHub devtools::install_github("ETC5523-2024/assignment-4-packages-and-shiny-apps-neharika999/movie")

title: Provides Tools for Exploring and Analyzing Summer-Themed Movies Using IMDb Data
text: filter_movies_by_genre() function filters movies genre. see comedy movies:
code: # Filtering for comedy movies filtered_data <- summer_movies %>% filter(genres=="Drama") head(filtered_data)

what: Example: Plotting Average Ratings Over Time
title: Provides Tools for Exploring and Analyzing Summer-Themed Movies Using IMDb Data
text: Use ggplot2 visualize trends filtered data. ’s example plotting average ratings time specific genre:
code: library(ggplot2)  # Average rating plot for comedy movies over time ggplot(filtered_data, aes(x = year, y = average_rating)) +   geom_line(color = "blue") +   geom_point() +   labs(title = "Average Ratings of Comedy Movies Over Time",        x = "Year", y = "Average Rating")

title: Provides Tools for Exploring and Analyzing Summer-Themed Movies Using IMDb Data
text: package includes interactive Shiny app allows users explore data web interface. can launch app using following command: Shiny app provides easy way : Select specific genres filter rating year range. View interactive plots gain insights summer-themed movies.

title: Provides Tools for Exploring and Analyzing Summer-Themed Movies Using IMDb Data
text: package includes vignette demonstrates use features. Load vignette follows:

title: Provides Tools for Exploring and Analyzing Summer-Themed Movies Using IMDb Data
text: encounter issues like contribute development movie package, feel free create pull request submit issue GitHub.

title: Filter Movies by Genre — filter_movies_by_genre
text: function filters summer_movies dataset specified genre. "" selected, returns entire dataset without filtering.

title: Filter Movies by Genre — filter_movies_by_genre
text: data data frame containing movie data, summer_movies. genre character string specifying genre filter . Use "" include genres.

title: Filter Movies by Genre — filter_movies_by_genre
text: data frame filtered specified genre.

title: Filter Movies by Genre — filter_movies_by_genre
code: data("summer_movies") # Filter for Comedy movies filter_movies_by_genre(summer_movies, "Comedy") #> # A tibble: 274 × 10 #>    tconst   title_type primary_title original_title  year runtime_minutes genres #>    <chr>    <chr>      <chr>         <chr>          <dbl>           <dbl> <chr>  #>  1 tt00267… movie      A Midsummer … A Midsummer N…  1935             133 Comed… #>  2 tt00338… movie      The Teachers… Magistrarna p…  1941              86 Comedy #>  3 tt00393… movie      One Swallow … En fluga gör …  1947              88 Comedy #>  4 tt00415… movie      In the Good … In the Good O…  1949             102 Comed… #>  5 tt00429… movie      Bountiful Su… Shchedroe leto  1951              87 Comed… #>  6 tt00433… movie      Early Summer  Bakushû         1951             125 Comed… #>  7 tt00472… movie      Summer's Clo… Nubes de vera…  1955              88 Comed… #>  8 tt00486… movie      Smiles of a … Sommarnattens…  1955             109 Comed… #>  9 tt00486… movie      Summertime    Summertime      1955             100 Comed… #> 10 tt00494… movie      Love, Summer… Liebe, Sommer…  1956              96 Comed… #> # ℹ 264 more rows #> # ℹ 3 more variables: simple_title <chr>, average_rating <dbl>, num_votes <dbl>

title: Launch the Shiny Application — launch_app
text: function launches Shiny application exploring summer-themed movies. app provides interactive filtering options genre, year range, minimum rating, along visualizations analyze trends distributions movie data.

title: Launch the Shiny Application — launch_app
text: Launches Shiny application interactive data exploration.

title: Summarize Genre Statistics — summarize_genre_statistics
text: function provides summary statistics genre dataset, including count movies, mean rating, median rating.

title: Summarize Genre Statistics — summarize_genre_statistics
text: data data frame containing movie data, summer_movies.

title: Summarize Genre Statistics — summarize_genre_statistics
text: data frame summary statistics genre.

title: Summarize Genre Statistics — summarize_genre_statistics
code: data("summer_movies") # Get genre statistics summarize_genre_statistics(summer_movies) #> # A tibble: 161 × 4 #>    genres               movie_count mean_rating median_rating #>    <chr>                      <int>       <dbl>         <dbl> #>  1 Drama                        188        6.30          6.3  #>  2 Comedy                        63        5.94          6.1  #>  3 Drama,Romance                 63        6.37          6.5  #>  4 Documentary                   49        7.38          7.3  #>  5 Comedy,Drama                  46        6.43          6.3  #>  6 Comedy,Drama,Romance          35        6.12          5.9  #>  7 Romance                       24        6.05          6.2  #>  8 Comedy,Romance                23        6.03          6.2  #>  9 Horror                        20        4.83          5.05 #> 10 NA                            18        6.19          6.4  #> # ℹ 151 more rows
